title: Ministry of Disaster Preparedness and Refugees (Uganda)
text:
The Ministry of Disaster Preparedness and Refugees is a <a href="Cabinet%20of%20Uganda">cabinet</a>-level government ministry of <a href="Uganda">Uganda</a>. The ministry is responsible for the coordination of all refugee matters in the country. It is also responsible for national preparedness for disasters, including floods, landslides, earthquakes, droughts, and famine.
<a href="Hillary%20Onek">Hillary Onek</a> is the minister of disaster preparedness and refugees.
Location.
The headquarters of the ministry are located in the Twin Towers, Sir Apollo Kaggwa Road, in the <a href="Kampala%20Central%20Division">Central Division</a> of <a href="Kampala">Kampala</a>, Uganda's capital and largest city. The coordinates of the ministry headquarters are: 0°18'58.0"N, 32°35'11.0"E (Latitude:0.316111; Longitude:32.586389).
Overview.
The ministry is part of the <a href="Prime%20Minister%20of%20Uganda">office of the prime minister of Uganda</a> (OPM).
Administrative structure.
The cabinet minister is assisted by Minister of State for Relief and Disaster Preparedness <a href="Musa%20Ecweru">Musa Ecweru</a>. <a href="Christine%20Guwatudde%20Kintu">Christine Guwatudde Kintu</a> is the ministry's chief accounting officer.
